A.1.subject: ELA
A.1.skill_name: Find the letter in the alphabet: uppercase

instruction.title: Let's Learn About Numbers!
instruction.content: Hi Sam Brown! Today we're learning to count and recognize numbers.
instruction.concept: Numbers help us count things and understand how many we have.

examples.question: What does the number 2 mean?
examples.answer: The number 2 means we have 2 things.
examples.explanation: If we have 2 apples, we can count: 1, 2.

keyPoints: Numbers help us count things
We can see numbers all around us
Counting helps us understand "how many"

exercises.question: Count these dots: • • How many dots are there?

assessment.question: Which number comes after 2?
assessment.explanation: Numbers go in order: 1, 2, 3... So 3 comes after 2!

feedback.correct: Perfect Sam Brown! You know your number order!
feedback.incorrect: Not quite, but keep practicing! Numbers go in order.

instruction.title: Let's Learn About Letters!
instruction.content: Hi Sam Brown! Today we're learning to find and recognize letters in the alphabet.
instruction.concept: Letters are the building blocks of words. Each letter has a shape and a sound.

examples.question: What does the letter C look like?
examples.answer: The letter C is an uppercase letter that looks like this: C
examples.explanation: We can find the letter C in many words, like "Apple" or "Ball".

keyPoints: Every letter has a special shape
We can find letters in the alphabet
Letters help us read and write words

exercises.question: Can you find the letter C in this row? A B C D E
exercises.hint: Look for the letter that matches: C
exercises.feedback: Great job finding the letter C!

assessment.question: Which letter comes after C in the alphabet?
options: D
B
E
C
assessment.explanation: The letters go in order: A, B, C, D, E... So D comes after C!

feedback.correct: Perfect Sam Brown! You know your alphabet order!
feedback.incorrect: Not quite, but keep practicing! The alphabet has a special order.

instruction.title: Let's Explore Science!
instruction.content: Hi Sam Brown! Today we're discovering the amazing world of science.
instruction.concept: Science helps us understand how things work and why things happen.

examples.question: What can we learn from science?
examples.answer: Science teaches us about animals, plants, weather, and how things move.
examples.explanation: Scientists ask questions and do experiments to learn new things!

keyPoints: Science helps us understand the world
We can observe and ask questions
Science is all around us

exercises.question: Look at a leaf. What do you notice about its color and shape?
exercises.hint: Use your eyes to observe carefully
exercises.feedback: Great observation! Scientists use their senses to learn.

assessment.question: What do scientists do?
options: They only read books
They ask questions and explore
They stay inside all day
They don't like learning
assessment.explanation: Scientists are curious and love to ask questions about how things work!

feedback.correct: Perfect Sam Brown! You think like a scientist!
feedback.incorrect: Keep exploring! Scientists are curious and ask lots of questions.

instruction.title: Let's Learn About Our Community!
instruction.content: Hi Sam Brown! Today we're learning about the people and places around us.
instruction.concept: A community is all the people who live and work together in the same place.

examples.question: Who are the helpers in our community?
examples.answer: Teachers, firefighters, doctors, and store workers help make our community great.
examples.explanation: Everyone in our community has a job that helps other people!

keyPoints: We are part of a community
People in our community help each other
Communities have schools, stores, and parks

exercises.question: Name a place in your community where people go to learn.
exercises.hint: Think about where children go during the day to learn new things
exercises.feedback: Yes! Schools are where people go to learn in our community.

assessment.question: What makes a good community?
options: People who never talk to each other
People who help and care for each other
Only one type of person
No rules or helpers
assessment.correctAnswer: People who help and care for each other
assessment.explanation: Good communities have people who work together and help each other!

feedback.correct: Wonderful Sam Brown! You understand what makes communities special!
feedback.incorrect: Keep learning! Good communities have people who care for each other.

instruction.title: Let's Learn Math!
instruction.content: Hi Alex Davis! Today we're exploring the wonderful world of math.
instruction.concept: Math helps us solve problems and understand the world around us.

examples.question: How do we use math every day?
examples.answer: We use math to count toys, share snacks, and measure things.
examples.explanation: Math is everywhere! We use it for cooking, shopping, and playing games.

keyPoints: Math helps us solve problems
We use math every day
Math can be fun and useful

exercises.question: If you have 2 apples and get 1 more, how many apples do you have?

assessment.question: What do we use math for?
options: Only for homework
Just for tests
To solve problems and count things
Nothing important
assessment.correctAnswer: To solve problems and count things
assessment.explanation: Math helps us solve problems and understand numbers in our daily life!

feedback.correct: Excellent Alex Davis! You understand why math is important!
feedback.incorrect: Keep learning! Math is useful for many things.

instruction.title: Let's Learn About Reading!
instruction.content: Hi Alex Davis! Today we're building our reading skills.
instruction.concept: Reading helps us understand stories and learn new things.

examples.question: Why is reading important?
examples.answer: Reading helps us learn about the world and understand stories.
examples.explanation: When we read, we can discover new places, meet new characters, and learn amazing facts!

keyPoints: Reading opens up new worlds
We can read books, signs, and stories
Practice makes reading easier and more fun

exercises.question: Read this simple sentence: "The cat sat on the mat." What animal is mentioned?
exercises.hint: Look for the animal word in the sentence
exercises.feedback: Yes! The cat is the animal in the sentence.

assessment.question: What do good readers do?
options: They skip words they don't know
They read too fast to understand
They think about what they're reading
They only read short words
assessment.correctAnswer: They think about what they're reading
assessment.explanation: Good readers think about the story and try to understand what's happening!

feedback.correct: Excellent Alex Davis! You understand what good reading is!
feedback.incorrect: Keep learning! Good readers take time to understand the story.

instruction.title: Let's Explore Science!
instruction.content: Hi Alex Davis! Today we're discovering the amazing world of science.
instruction.concept: Science helps us understand how things work and why things happen.

examples.question: What can we learn from science?
examples.answer: Science teaches us about animals, plants, weather, and how things move.
examples.explanation: Scientists ask questions and do experiments to learn new things!

keyPoints: Science helps us understand the world
We can observe and ask questions

exercises.question: Look at a leaf. What do you notice about its color and shape?
exercises.hint: Use your eyes to observe carefully
exercises.feedback: Great observation! Scientists use their senses to learn.

options: They only read books
They ask questions and explore
They stay inside all day
They don't like learning
assessment.explanation: Scientists are curious and love to ask questions about how things work!

feedback.correct: Perfect Alex Davis! You think like a scientist!
feedback.incorrect: Keep exploring! Scientists are curious and ask lots of questions.

instruction.title: Let's Learn About Our Community!
instruction.content: Hi Alex Davis! Today we're learning about the people and places around us.
instruction.concept: A community is all the people who live and work together in the same place.

examples.question: Who are the helpers in our community?
examples.answer: Teachers, firefighters, doctors, and store workers help make our community great.
examples.explanation: Everyone in our community has a job that helps other people!

keyPoints: We are part of a community
People in our community help each other
Communities have schools, stores, and parks

exercises.question: Name a place in your community where people go to learn.

assessment.explanation: Good communities have people who work together and help each other!

instruction.title: Let's Learn Math!
instruction.content: Hi Jordan Smith! Today we're exploring the wonderful world of math.
instruction.concept: Math helps us solve problems and understand the world around us.

examples.question: How do we use math every day?
examples.answer: We use math to count toys, share snacks, and measure things.
examples.explanation: Math is everywhere! We use it for cooking, shopping, and playing games.

keyPoints: Math helps us solve problems
We use math every day
Math can be fun and useful

exercises.question: If you have 2 apples and get 1 more, how many apples do you have?

assessment.question: What do we use math for?
options: Only for homework
Just for tests
To solve problems and count things
Nothing important
assessment.correctAnswer: To solve problems and count things
assessment.explanation: Math helps us solve problems and understand numbers in our daily life!

feedback.correct: Excellent Jordan Smith! You understand why math is important!
feedback.incorrect: Keep learning! Math is useful for many things.

instruction.title: Let's Learn About Reading!
instruction.content: Hi Jordan Smith! Today we're building our reading skills.
instruction.concept: Reading helps us understand stories and learn new things.

examples.question: Why is reading important?
examples.answer: Reading helps us learn about the world and understand stories.
examples.explanation: When we read, we can discover new places, meet new characters, and learn amazing facts!

keyPoints: Reading opens up new worlds
We can read books, signs, and stories
Practice makes reading easier and more fun

exercises.question: Read this simple sentence: "The cat sat on the mat." What animal is mentioned?
exercises.hint: Look for the animal word in the sentence
exercises.feedback: Yes! The cat is the animal in the sentence.

assessment.question: What do good readers do?
options: They skip words they don't know
They read too fast to understand
They think about what they're reading
They only read short words
assessment.correctAnswer: They think about what they're reading
assessment.explanation: Good readers think about the story and try to understand what's happening!

feedback.correct: Excellent Jordan Smith! You understand what good reading is!
feedback.incorrect: Keep learning! Good readers take time to understand the story.

instruction.title: Let's Explore Science!
instruction.content: Hi Jordan Smith! Today we're discovering the amazing world of science.
instruction.concept: Science helps us understand how things work and why things happen.

examples.question: What can we learn from science?
examples.answer: Science teaches us about animals, plants, weather, and how things move.
examples.explanation: Scientists ask questions and do experiments to learn new things!

keyPoints: Science helps us understand the world
We can observe and ask questions
Science is all around us

exercises.question: Look at a leaf. What do you notice about its color and shape?
exercises.hint: Use your eyes to observe carefully
exercises.feedback: Great observation! Scientists use their senses to learn.

assessment.question: What do scientists do?
options: They only read books
They ask questions and explore
They stay inside all day
They don't like learning
assessment.explanation: Scientists are curious and love to ask questions about how things work!

feedback.correct: Perfect Jordan Smith! You think like a scientist!
feedback.incorrect: Keep exploring! Scientists are curious and ask lots of questions.

instruction.title: Let's Learn About Our Community!
instruction.content: Hi Jordan Smith! Today we're learning about the people and places around us.
instruction.concept: A community is all the people who live and work together in the same place.

examples.question: Who are the helpers in our community?
examples.answer: Teachers, firefighters, doctors, and store workers help make our community great.
examples.explanation: Everyone in our community has a job that helps other people!

keyPoints: We are part of a community
People in our community help each other
Communities have schools, stores, and parks

exercises.question: Name a place in your community where people go to learn.
exercises.hint: Think about where children go during the day to learn new things
exercises.feedback: Yes! Schools are where people go to learn in our community.

assessment.question: What makes a good community?
options: People who never talk to each other
People who help and care for each other
Only one type of person
No rules or helpers
assessment.correctAnswer: People who help and care for each other
assessment.explanation: Good communities have people who work together and help each other!

feedback.correct: Wonderful Jordan Smith! You understand what makes communities special!
feedback.incorrect: Keep learning! Good communities have people who care for each other.
